annotations: President Bush chose Martin Allday , a longtime friend from Texas , to be chairman of the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission .
Mr. Allday would succeed Martha Hesse , who is resigning .
The White House said Ms. Hesse , a Chicago businesswoman who previously held posts at the Energy Department and FERC , is leaving to become a vice president of First Chicago Corp .
Mr. Allday , an attorney in Midland , Texas , has been solicitor at the Interior Department .
He met Mr. Bush in the 1950s , when the president was a young oil man in Midland and Mr. Allday was a lawyer for an oil firm .
The FERC is a five - member commission that regulates billions of dollars of interstate wholesale energy transactions .
Mr. Allday 's appointment is subject to confirmation by the Senate .
Administration officials said a date for Ms. Hesse 's departure has n't been set .
